title: David Becomes King of Judah
summary: David is anointed king over Judah and reigns in Hebron. Meanwhile, Saul’s son Ish-Bosheth is made king over Israel by Abner, leading to civil war between the two sides.

faq.question: Where was David first anointed king?
faq.answer: In Hebron, over the tribe of Judah.

faq.question: Who led Saul’s side against David?
faq.answer: Abner, the commander of Saul’s army, supported Ish-Bosheth.
